args:
Mitsuhide confesses to inventing the legend of
the buried gold in order to laze about, yet her
true aim was to revitalize the impoverished
village. Even so, Ieyasu believes the well holds
a link to his past, and continues the excavation.
You think I'M the one who buried the\ngolden statue down there?
No, we think you put EVERYTHING down\nthere. The teacup, the tools... The works.
They all SEEM old, but if ya take a closer\nlook, they were all made in the last few\nyears.
I'm told that a variety of techniques exist\nto make modern objects look older.\n＂Antiquing,＂ it's called.
Makes it kinda hard not to doubt that any\nof it was really buried here in the first\nplace.
So, to put a finer point on it...
You're saying every scrap of evidence that\nhas turned up in that cave is a counterfeit,\nall created and planted by me.
Please. That's absurd. Do you honestly\nthink I'd go to that much trouble?
Not in a million years. But what if you\nhad someone else do all the work?
Last night, I caught one of your mice on\nhis way to bury a new bit of ＂evidence.＂
Bonnie is a friend. I'm hardly his boss.\nHave YOU ever tried giving orders to a\nmouse?
It might be hard for you, but not for your\npactbound dragon, Daikokuten. I myself\nhave no trouble chatting with boars.
I could give Maribelle or Rawn a call. They\ncan talk to animals like it's nothin'. We can\nsee what Bonnie has to say for himself.
Even the carving of my family crest on the\nwell turned out to be a recent addition.
Mitsuhide. It's time you laid the truth bare.
*sigh* I didn't think you'd be quite this\neager to play junior detective.
Yup. It was all orchestrated by yours truly\nas part of Project Celestial Rock Cave.
Heh heh heh... It's a top-secret operation—
To buy me some extra time to laze about!
While I was staying at that village, I found\nthe empty well by happy coincidence. It\nwas the perfect spot to hole up and nap in.
On the plus side, I knew nobody would bug\nme there, but by the same token, I wasn't\nabout to dig the darn thing out myself.
That's when I heard the legend of the\nburied gold. Between that and the tale\nof your family's tanuki, inspiration struck.
If I could tie the two together, you would\ncome and do all the heavy lifting for me.
So you carved his family crest into the well\nand sat back to watch us do the rest.
I'll admit that the imperial troops and\nRanzal's crew joining the mix was...\nunexpected.

Those little ＂relics＂ you found along the
way were supposed to keep you going.
A motivated minion is an effective minion,
after all.
I figured if I didn't reward you at all, you\nmight give up before the job was done.
So you lied to all of us because you\nwanted some kind of weird, underground\nburrow to sleep in? Are you serious?
Deadly. ＂Use every tool at your disposal.＂\nThat's my credo.
Because when I nap, I don't want ANY\ninterruptions!
*sigh* I've gone past anger clear into\ndisbelief.
I'll see that you're all compensated for\nyour labor, so let's call it square, yeah?
Keep your money.\nWe came here for the adventure.
Getting paid for it makes the whole thing\nfeel even sadder. C'mon, guys. Let's go.
Darn. So much for my little scheme.\nAh, well. I guess this is deep enough.
Mitsuhide. A word, if you please.
Oh, are you still here? Isn't Sazanka back\nhome waiting for you under a mountain of\npaperwork?
I thought I'd hear the truth from you before\nmaking the return trip to Hinomoto.
I have my doubts. You always take care\nto see that your schemes benefit others\nas well.
You sure about that? But all right,\nlet's hear your theory, junior detective.
Who benefited the most from this farce?\nThe people of Aquagi.
Our excavation effort spread rumors of\nburied gold far and wide, bringing tourists\nto their struggling village.
Plus, I don't buy for a second that they\ndidn't know about this well.
If we posit that you were assisting\ntheir village revitalization efforts,\neverything clicks into place.
I suspect the tale of buried treasure was an\ninvention of yours in the first place, to help\nbring attention to Aquagi.
But a legend alone doesn't bring much foot\ntraffic. You need someone to take the tale\nseriously to add the allure of credibility.
And so you used, rather callously, the story\nof the tanuki to get me to play that role.
You chose not to clue Ranzal and the\nothers in on your scheme in order to\nprotect your co-conspirators—the villagers.
...I give up. The way you see through me\nis legitimately terrifying, you know that?
Sounds like Ieyasu's got your number.\nWhat was your aim in all this?
To pay them back for their frankly unreal\nservice during my stay there, I suppose.\nAnd you've seen the shape Aquagi is in.

The fishing trade's dried up. They're doing
their best to attract tourists, but failing.
I didn't want the place to end up a ghost
town.
Make no mistake: I really did have every\nintention of scoring a sweet hibernation\ncave out of the deal.
But involving you two was my idea.\nDon't hold that against the villagers.
I know well how desperately they've been\nworking to make ends meet. I would never\nblame them for doing what they must.
Nor would I blame you for trying to aid\nthem...though I'll admit to feeling a bit\ndisappointed. And exasperated with you.
Soft as ever. Whatever my reasons,\nI used you. Lied to you.
But you're discerning with your victims.\nI'll take my involvement in your scheme\nas a sign of affection.
Ugh... I can feel my grip on sanity slipping\nwhen I'm around you.
Circling back around to the legend of\nburied treasure: just where does the\nfiction end and fact begin?
Huh? It's all made up. Start to finish.
I'm not convinced. It takes a lot of work to\nmanufacture a plausible lie. I wondered if\nit wasn't based on some other old story.
Right again. We added the bit about the\nkid seeing the samurai bury gold at the\nbottom of the well.
The rest was an old tale they told in the\nvillage. The children's song, too.
＂The samurai clad in eyes of eight.\nHe dug the well, it couldn't wait.＂
＂But if you find his treasure well,\nyou'll see the steaming mouth of hell...＂\nDo I recall correctly?
Yup. The cavern you found has\nbeen down there forever as well.
But we decided it'd be no fun if you saw\nit without breaking a sweat, so I had the\nvillagers help seal up the entrance.
So it's not totally implausible that a\nsamurai who washed up in the village\ndug the well after all.
And if that's true, his identity may well be\nthe tanuki we've been pursuing all along.
Oh, come on. I just used that as an excuse\nto drag you into this.
Then was the pillbox bearing the eight\nboar's eye crest another of your plants?
The what, now? I don't know anything\nabout a pillbox.
I was so excited upon discovering it that I\nmust have forgotten to mention it to you.
Among the objects I asked Marty to\nappraise, that box alone turned out to\nbe over a hundred years old.
Well, if Mitsuhide didn't plant it...
Then the truth may yet lie at the bottom of\nthat cave.
